chist.name: Chist
chist.description: Chist is a web application to share your chats from different sources (Skype, IRC, Slack) in a unified style. When you work in a distributed team, chatting with different people and then having to communicate the minutes of your conversation to other team members becomes a really common situation. Chist helps you doing that. Share a “chist” of your chats

funky-world-cup.name: Funky World Cup
funky-world-cup.description: Funky World Cup is a match predictions website for the FIFA World Cup, that allows you to create groups so you can play with your friends defining prices.

bluetail.name: Bluetail
bluetail.description: Named after a kind of blue bird, Bluetail is a small, easy to use Ruby library to make Twitter posts with your apps. This library is a spin-off of the Funky World Cup project.

crocodile.name: Crocodile
crocodile.description: Crocodile is a gem for running periodic [background] jobs written in Ruby. Crocodile provides a worker binary that's in charge of running the jobs you define, it also provides a base class for those jobs. This library is a spin-off of the Funky World Cup project.

cuba-flash.name: Cuba Flash
cuba-flash.description: Cuba Flash provides flash-style messages to Cuba apps. Flash messages are shown only once, they are used to show notifications after a certain operations in a web app
